ratings.comment: As a person, she's very sweet and understanding; however, I wouldn't recommend her as a professor. She doesn't record lectures, nor does she post the slides, so you have to do all the work by yourself. I have taken calc 1, so I skipped all lectures and only studied the previous exams and managed to get an A in her class.

Attendance isn't mandatory, but if you don't go to lecture, it will be hard as she doesn't post her slides on canvas. If I didn't have notes from lecture, I wouldn't have been able to pass. She rushes through a lot, and I learned more from youtube because she wasn't very thorough. She seems like a good person, but not a great prof.
Very good at explaining the fundamentals of calculus! Easy to follow along with her work during lectures and spends the right amount of time teaching each topic throughout the semester.

Attending lecture is pretty much required to get a good grade, it can be difficult to get necessary help if you miss it. Her lectures are pretty good though, she mixes stories and humor in to get you through. She's a very nice person too, though it can be hard to understand some of her explanations and get help outside class.

Grade for 221 was basically three exams: two midterms and a final. However, Professor Li gave out plenty of examples in lectures and explained concepts clearly. Make sure to go to discussions though if you want even more examples to get a better understanding on everything that was taught in lectures.

This was Professor Li's first time teaching a Calc 1 class... it showed. She rushed through lectures and made a lot of mistakes while lecturing. I got more out of watching YouTube videos than attending her lectures. She did not go in-depth with the content like would be expected of us on the exams. Nice person, but not a great professor.

While 514 was a tough class, Qin made every class incredibly meaningful and inspirational. She has a very sweet, kind demeanor and cares a lot about her students. She's also very accessible for help outside class, and there's a course assistant for that as well. Qin is extremely knowledgable and her research-oriented mind is very impressive.

Professor Li was really good at explaining concepts from the textbooks and making them easier to understand. Also, I liked that she sometimes expanded on the topic making the lectures more interesting. I would recommend this class with this lecturer for anyone with an interest in math.

She is a very kind person but a terrible lecturer. I stopped going halfway through the semester but fortunately the class itself is not that difficult and I was able to self-teach and still got an A. Would not recommend

Qin Li is the sweetest professor I've had. She is very passionate when it comes to math and it shows. I recommend you take her section if you can. Be prepared for lecture. She will not waste a minute of time.

Very nice professor! Actually I've taken 3 courses taught by her. I love her! She always gives you clear explanations in the class and relative HW (not much and not tough when understand what she said in class). She will tell you what will appear in the exam in review section before every exam and if you review by her guide, you'll have good grade.

I walked out of the class not knowing anything about linear algebra. I got nothing out of the class. There are no quizzes or practice exams to help with learning the material. She has review sessions in class where she tells you what kinds of questions are going to be on the exams but the exams are still difficult.

Was never explained how the material we were taught in class was going to be used, went too quick through topics for students to understand and didnt go in enough depth for students to comprehend the topics. Didnt get much out of the class.

Absolutely would not recommend. Grades in class were not clear and at the end of semester she dodged questions on grading and didnt answer mine until after she had put them into the final grade book. Left the class defeated and very disappointed.

Her lectures were just her reading from the textbook. There were no quizzes or practice exams, only a midterm and a final. She doesn't give anything to prepare for either of these. The questions on the exam are much different than what she reviews and she is hard to reach outside of class. Would recommend any other math professor.

I completely disagree with this rating. The lectures are so unclear and there is no communication on what you need to know for tests. Homework and worksheets (the ONLY resources to study) do NOT REFLECT EXAM QUESTIONS. The canvas page has nothing on it except homework problems. The exams make no sense and are impossible to complete within the time.

She's super practical and gives lots of examples. Material covered on exams is very clear and homework problems reflect what is learned in lecture. I never thought I'd use the word adorable to describe my math professor, but Qin Li fits that. She's stopped lecture multiple times to bless someone who sneezed. Take her class!!
Nice professor, very experienced. Respond to students' question fast and accurately.
Great professor. Great attitude towards students! Very nice.

Best math professor ever. Simplifies the concepts and makes them really clear for students to know what to focus. Explains theorems with multiple examples that show how to solve problems instead of just giving complicated proofs. Review lectures before each exam, telling you exactly what's on the exams.

Best math professor I've had. I understood everything she taught. She tells you EXACTLY what you need to know and how to do it to do well on the exams. (Like almost tells you what is on the exams). She gives you extra credit if you correct her in class, so pay attention. Don't underestimate how much you need to study for the exam though.

Excellent lecturer and makes difficult concepts and theories easy to understand. Going to her in office hours, she was very helpful in re-explaining ideas and giving helpful tips on the assignments. Tests were fair but there is a lot of material in this class. I'd highly recommend having taken more math classes than listed in the pre-reqs.

Professor Li makes the class pretty easy. She is a good lecturer and is very clear explaining concepts. The lecture before the exams she goes over every concept that will be on the exam very clearly and tells you what to study, there are no surprises. Don't skip lecture.

She is awesome. Knowledge is delivered clearly in her lecture. Homework is on the textbook. Three midterms, all are non-cumulative. For every exam, there will be a review class to go over exam material, which is super helpful. Examples in the review class almost the same as questions on the exams. Her course curves too. Not a hard A if you go lec

Amazing math prof! Would absolutely take her again. Great lecturer, extremely clear and easy to follow because she shows exactly how she does it, doesn't skip steps. Super sweet and funny too. Best math professor I've had so far.

Very good lecturer. Takes you through everything you need to know. Tests are very straightforward. She's very helpful--I had to go to the hospital the night before the final, and she was super nice when it came to rescheduling .
She gave really clear lectures and were approachable. Very helpful during office hours. Tests were not bad.

Good lecturer. Straightforward. Accent isn't really a problem at all. Clear and to the point, and helpful. The class itself is pretty easy, if you actually go. I can pretty much guarantee that if you go to most lectures you'll get above a B. One homework per week, takes an hour tops. 2 midterms, 1 final. Class on a curve.
